action.action-desc: Mr. Johnson of South Dakota (for himself, Mr. Norman, and Mr. Mast) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committees on Armed Services, and Oversight and Reform, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To establish certain requirements relating to TikTok, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Block the Tok Act.

section.header: Limitation on the access of user data of United States citizens
section.text: TikTok may not access user data of United States citizens from within the People’s Republic of China.

subsection.text: Not later than 60 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Commission shall initiate an investigation to determine if TikTok has engaged in unfair or deceptive acts or practices within the meaning of section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (15 U.S.C. 45(a)(1)).

Not later than 30 days after the date on which the Commission completes the investigation described in subsection (a), if the Commission determines TikTok has engaged in unfair or deceptive acts or practices within the meaning of section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (15 U.S.C. 45(a)(1)) and if the Commission determines that a proceeding by the Commission would be in the interest of the public, the Commission shall issue and serve upon TikTok a complaint stating the charges that contains a notice of a hearing on a fixed date and place at least thirty days after the date on which the complaint is served.

section.header: Prohibition on the use of TikTok at military installations and Federal agencies

subsection.text: Not later than 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act—

paragraph.text: TikTok may not be downloaded or used on a personal electronic device at a military installation or a Federal agency; and
TikTok, if on a personal electronic device at a military installation or a Federal agency on the date of the enactment of this Act, shall be removed from the personal electronic device.

subsection.text: The head of the relevant Federal agency may authorize an exception to the prohibition described in subsection (a).

section.header: Prohibition on the use of TikTok on Federal Government devices

subsection.text: Not later than 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act—

paragraph.text: TikTok may not be downloaded or used on information technology; and
TikTok, if on information technology on the date of the enactment of this Act, shall be removed from the information technology.

subsection.text: The Chair of the Commission or the head of a Federal agency may authorize an exception to the prohibition described in subsection (a) if the Chair or the head of the relevant Federal agency determines that it is appropriate for the purpose of an investigation to determine if TikTok has engaged in unfair or deceptive acts or practices within the meaning of section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (15 U.S.C. 45(a)(1)).

paragraph.text: The term Commission means the Federal Trade Commission.
The term Federal agency includes the following:

subparagraph.text: Air Force Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance Agency.
Office of the Director of National Intelligence.
Office of Intelligence and Counterintelligence of the Department of Energy.

paragraph.text: The term information technology has the meaning given that term in section 11101 of title 40, United States Code.
The term military installation has the meaning given that term in section 2801 of title 10, United States Code.
The term personal electronic device, with respect to an employee of a military installation or a Federal agency, means—

subparagraph.text: an electronic device that was not provided to the employee by the relevant military installation or Federal agency for the business of such military installation or Federal agency; or

an electronic device that was provided to the employee by the relevant military installation or Federal agency for the business of such military installation or Federal agency but that was used by such employee for a purpose other than the business of such military installation or Federal agency.
